info.title: Hyperledger Cactus Plugin - Connector Fabric
info.description: Can perform basic tasks on a fabric ledger

VaultTransitKey.description: vault key details for signing fabric message with private key stored with transit engine.

WebSocketKey.description: web-socket key details for signing fabric message with private key stored with external client

FabricSigningCredentialType.description: different type of identity provider for singing fabric messages supported by this package

type.description: singing identity type to be used for signing fabric message , by by default default is supported

vaultTransitKey.description: vault key details , if Vault-X.509 identity provider to be used for singing fabric messages

webSocketKey.description: web-socket key details , if WS-X.509 identity provider to be used for singing fabric messages

ChainCodeProgrammingLanguage.description: Enumerates the supported source code programming languages of Hyperledger Fabric

ChainCodeLanguageRuntime.description: Enumerates the supported programming language runtimes of Hyperledger Fabric

strategy.description: The name of the strategy to be used when looking up the TxEventHandlerFactory to pass in to the Fabric Gateway as the strategy property of the discovery options.

FileBase64.description: Represents a file-system file that has a name and a body which holds the file contents as a Base64 encoded string

body.description: The file's contents encoded as a Base64 string.

filename.description: The name as referred to on a file system

filepath.description: The relative path of the file, if it should be placed in a sub-directory

RunTransactionResponseType.description: Response format from transaction / query execution

endorsingPeers.description: An array of endorsing peers (name or url) for the transaction.

endorsingOrgs.description: An array of endorsing organizations (by mspID or issuer org name on certificate) for the transaction.

invocationType.description: Indicates if it is a CALL or a SEND type of invocation where only SEND ends up creating an actual transaction on the ledger.

endorsingPeers.description: An array of endorsing peers (name or url) for the transaction.

endorsingOrgs.description: An array of endorsing organizations (by mspID or issuer org name on certificate) for the transaction.

uniqueTransactionData.description: Can be used to uniquely identify and authorize signing request

invocationType.description: Indicates if it is a CALL or a SEND type of invocation where only SEND ends up creating an actual transaction on the ledger.

CORE_PEER_LOCALMSPID.description: Mapped to environment variables of the Fabric CLI container.

CORE_PEER_ADDRESS.description: Mapped to environment variables of the Fabric CLI container.

CORE_PEER_MSPCONFIGPATH.description: Mapped to environment variables of the Fabric CLI container.

CORE_PEER_TLS_ROOTCERT_FILE.description: Mapped to environment variables of the Fabric CLI container.

ORDERER_TLS_ROOTCERT_FILE.description: Mapped to environment variables of the Fabric CLI container.

transient.description: Transient map of arguments in JSON encoding

CORE_PEER_LOCALMSPID.description: Mapped to environment variables of the Fabric CLI container.

CORE_PEER_ADDRESS.description: Mapped to environment variables of the Fabric CLI container.

CORE_PEER_MSPCONFIGPATH.description: Mapped to environment variables of the Fabric CLI container.

CORE_PEER_TLS_ROOTCERT_FILE.description: Mapped to environment variables of the Fabric CLI container.

ORDERER_TLS_ROOTCERT_FILE.description: Mapped to environment variables of the Fabric CLI container.

tlsRootCertFiles.description: The TLS root cert files that will be passed to the chaincode instantiation command.

channelId.description: The name of the Fabric channel where the contract will get instantiated.

targetPeerAddresses.description: An array of peer addresses where the contract will be instantiated. Note that at present only the first item from this array will be used which is the behavior taken from the official Fabric samples repository and therefore it is assumed to be correct usage.

constructorArgs.example: {} - An empty object literal can be sufficient if your contract does not have parameters.

goSource.description: The your-smart-contract.go file where the functionality of your contract is implemented.

goMod.description: The go.mod file that declares the dependencies of the chaincode go contract that is being deployed as part of this request.

moduleName.description: The go module name that will be used for the go compilation process.

modTidyOnly.description: Indicates to the go chaincode compiler of Cactus if it should do an actual go compilation with the contact source or if it should just execute the go mod tidy command.

caFile.description: File-system path pointing at the CA file.

orderer.description: Ordering service endpoint specified as <hostname or IP address>:<port>

ordererTLSHostnameOverride.description: The hostname override to use when validating the TLS connection to the orderer

signaturePolicy.description: Passed in to the peer via the --signature-policy argument on the command line. See also: https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/release-2.2/endorsement-policies.html#setting-chaincode-level-endorsement-policies

collectionsConfigFile.description: Name of the collections config file as present in the sourceFiles array of the request.

channelId.description: The name of the Fabric channel where the contract will get instantiated.

constructorArgs.example: {} - An empty object literal can be sufficient if your contract does not have parameters.

ccLabel.description: Human readable label to uniquely identify the contract. Recommended to include in this at least the contract name and the exact version in order to make it easily distinguishable from other deployments of the same contract.

sourceFiles.description: The your-smart-contract.go file where the functionality of your contract is implemented.

channelName.description: Fabric channel which we want to query.

connectionChannelName.description: Fabric channel we want to connect to. If not provided, then one from channelName parameter will be used

query.description: Query selector, caller must provide at least one of them. First found will be used, rest will be ignored, so it's recommended to pass single selector.

encoding.description: NodeJS Buffer encoding (utf-8, hex, binary, base64, etc...). Passed directly to `Buffer.from()` call on hashBuffer. If not provided then JSON buffer format is assumed.

buffer.description: Buffer of blockHash. It's encoding should be described in `encoding` parameter.

transactionId.description: Select block by id of transaction that it contains.

skipDecode.description: If true, encoded buffer will be returned. Otherwise, entire block object is returned.

GetBlockResponseDecodedV1.description: When skipDecode is false (default) then decoded block object is returned.

GetBlockResponseEncodedV1.description: When skipDecode is true then encoded block Buffer is returned.

WatchBlocksV1.description: Websocket requests for monitoring new blocks.

WatchBlocksListenerTypeV1.description: Response type from WatchBlocks. 'Cactus*' are custom views, others correspond to fabric SDK call.

WatchBlocksOptionsV1.description: Options passed when subscribing to block monitoring.

channelName.description: Hyperledger Fabric channel to connect to.

gatewayOptions.description: Options to Hyperledger Fabric Node SDK Gateway

type.description: Type of response block to return.

startBlock.description: From which block start monitoring. Defaults to latest.

WatchBlocksDelegatedSignOptionsV1.description: Options passed when subscribing to block monitoring with delegated signing.

type.description: Type of response block to return.

startBlock.description: From which block start monitoring. Defaults to latest.

uniqueTransactionData.description: Can be used to uniquely identify and authorize signing request

chaincodeId.description: ChainCode containing function that was executed.

WatchBlocksCactusTransactionsResponseV1.description: Custom response containing block transactions summary. Compatible with legacy fabric-socketio connector monitoring.

WatchBlocksFullResponseV1.description: Response that corresponds to Fabric SDK 'full' EventType.

WatchBlocksFilteredResponseV1.description: Response that corresponds to Fabric SDK 'filtered' EventType.

WatchBlocksPrivateResponseV1.description: Response that corresponds to Fabric SDK 'private' EventType.

WatchBlocksResponseV1.description: Response block from WatchBlocks endpoint. Depends on 'type' passed in subscription options.

post.summary: Runs a transaction on a Fabric ledger.
Runs a transaction on a Fabric ledger using user-provided signing callback.
get a transaction receipt by tx id on a Fabric ledger.
Deploys a chaincode contract in the form of a go sources.

Deploys a chaincode contract from a set of source files. Note: This endpoint only supports Fabric 2.x. The 'v1' suffix in the method name refers to the Cactus API version, not the supported Fabric ledger version.
Get block from the channel using one of selectors from the input. Works only on Fabric 2.x.
